content.text: 4 egg whites
content.eamr: ( ing-0 "4 egg whites" )

content.text: 1 1/4 cups white sugar
content.eamr: ( ing-1 "1 1/4 cups white sugar" )

content.text: 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
content.eamr: ( ing-2 "1 teaspoon vanilla extract" )

content.text: 1 teaspoon lemon juice
content.eamr: ( ing-3 "1 teaspoon lemon juice" )

content.text: 2 teaspoons cornstarch
content.eamr: ( ing-4 "2 teaspoons cornstarch" )

content.text: 1 pint heavy cream
content.eamr: ( ing-5 "1 pint heavy cream" )

content.text: 6 kiwi, peeled and sliced
content.eamr: ( ing-6 "6 kiwi, peeled and sliced" )

content.text: 0) Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
content.eamr:
( inst-0 / R
	:inform ( ac-0-0 "Preheat"@3:10 / AC
		:ppt ( tool-0-0 "oven"@11:15 / TOOL )
		:heat ( temp-0-0 "300 degrees F"@19:32 / TEMPERATURE )
		:heat ( temp-0-1 "150 degrees C"@34:47 / TEMPERATURE )
	)
)

content.text: 1) Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2) Draw a 9 inch circle on the parchment paper.
3) In a large bowl, beat egg whites until stiff but not dry.
content.eamr:
( inst-3 / R
	:inform ( ac-3-0 "beat"@20:24 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-0 "egg whites"@25:35 / FOOD )
		:until ( cond-3-0 "until stiff but not dry"@36:59 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:loc ( tool-3-0 "a large bowl"@6:18 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 4) Gradually add in the sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating well after each addition.
5) Beat until thick and glossy.
6) Overbeaten egg whites lose volume and deflate when folded into other ingredients.
7) Be absolutely sure not a particle of grease or egg yolk gets into the whites.
8) Gently fold in vanilla extract, lemon juice and cornstarch.
content.eamr:
( inst-8 / R
	:inform ( ac-8-0 "fold in"@10:17 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-2 "vanilla extract"@18:33 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-3 "lemon juice"@35:46 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-4 "cornstarch"@51:61 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 9) Spoon mixture inside the circle drawn on the parchment paper.
content.eamr:
( inst-9 / R
	:inform ( ac-9-0 "Spoon"@3:8 / AC
		:ppt ( "mixture"@9:16 / FOOD )
		:gol ( "the circle"@24:34 / OTHER )
	)
	:inform ( tool-9-0 "the parchment paper"@44:63 / TOOL )
)

content.text: 10) Working from the center, spread mixture toward the outside edge, building edge slightly.
11) This should leave a slight depression in the center.
12) Bake for 1 hour.
13) Cool on a wire rack.
14) Remove the paper, and place meringue on a flat serving plate.
15) Fill the center of the meringue with whipped cream, sweetened if desired.
16) Top whipped cream with kiwifruit slices.
